Question: How critical is this {project} to your company's mission/business?
Type of answer: Scale of 1-10 where 1 is "Highly critical" and 10 is "not critical at all," plus an "I don't know" option
Answers: value=100;label="1 (highly critical)" | value=90;label="2" | value=80;label="3" | value=70;label="4" | value=60;label="5" | value=50;label="6" | value=40;label="7" | value=30;label="8" | value=20;label="9" | value=10;label="10 (not critical at all)" | value=100;label="I don't know"
Logic:
IF 1, RAISE 100
IF 2, RAISE 90
IF 3, RAISE 80
IF 4, RAISE 70
IF 5, RAISE 60
IF 6, RAISE 50
IF 7, RAISE 40
IF 8, RAISE 30
IF 9, RAISE 20
IF 10, RAISE 10;
Notes:
Present examples of:
1) a business support project, such as an HR or payroll system
2) a business output project, such as product/service development or delivery.

Dave's Bubble: Refer to criticality analysis in dave's bubble
Question Info Text: For further information see NISTIR 8179, Criticality Analysis Process Model: Prioritizing Systems and Components, April 2018.
